title: Irish National Championships: Nick Griggs takes bronze as Cathal Doyle wins 1500m
description: Nick Griggs wins a bronze medal in the men's 1500m as Olympian Cathal Doyle takes gold at the Irish National Championships.
content:
Nick Griggs won a bronze medal in the men's 1500m at the Irish National Championships at Morton Stadium.

The race was won by Cathal Doyle, while Andrew Coscoran, who earlier won the men's 5000m, finished second.

European Under-23 silver medallist Griggs and Michael Power led a steady first lap and the race settled into a tactical battle.

Doyle had manoeuvred to the front by the bell, and Griggs showed a good kick heading into the final 100m as he tried to chase down the Olympic 1500m semi-finalist.

However, the 20-year-old came up just short of Doyle, who won in a time of 3:53.60, and the charging Coscoran (3:53.84) beat Griggs (3:53.90) to the line to take second.

While Olympian sprinter Rhasidat Adeleke and heptathlete Kate O'Connor were absent from the meeting, sprinter Sarah Lavin - one of the star attractions - won the women's 100 metre hurdles.

Fellow Olympian Coscoran beat Brian Fay in a tight men's 5000m final, while Sharlene Mawdsley claimed the women's 200m on Saturday ahead of Lavin.

Mawdsley withdrew from the 400m after her earlier medal, and that final was won by her 4x400m Paris team-mate Sophie Becker.

Jack Raftery claimed gold in the men's 400m, while Mark English won the men's 800m final.

Ciara Neville and Bori Akinola won their respective women's and men's 100m finals, and Alex O'Neill pipped Sarah Healy in the women's 800m race.

After winning silver medals at the European Under-23 championships and the World University Games, Nicola Tuthill won the women's hammer throw at the Morton Stadium with a throw of 71.75m.
summary: Nick Griggs won bronze in the men's 1500m at the Irish National Championships at Morton Stadium, where Cathal Doyle won the race. Andrew Coscoran, who had earlier won the 5000m, finished second. Griggs and Doyle were a strong competitors, but Griggs failed to beat Doyle in the final 100m. Other notable events included the women's 100m hurdles, where Sarah Lavin won and fellow Olympians Alex O'Neill took home gold. Nicola Tuthill and Jack Raftery also won gold in the 400m and men's 800m respectively.
shortSummary: Nick Griggs won bronze in the men's 1500m at the Irish National Championships, where Cathal Doyle won, and Andrew Coscoran finished second.
argos_summary: Nick Griggs secured a bronze medal in the men's 1500m at the Irish National Championships, finishing behind Cathal Doyle and Andrew Coscoran. The race featured a tactical battle, with Griggs clocking 3:53.90. In other events, Sarah Lavin won the women's 100m hurdles, while Nicola Tuthill triumphed in the women's hammer throw with a distance of 71.75m.
